results.title: Catchwords: ideas for spelling
results.creator_credit: Educational Technology Unit, Toorak State College and O. Hollander
results.brief_description: Charles Cripps, author of the spelling manual “Catchwords” is interviewed by Sue Brockfield and Howard Mould. Cripps outlines several strategies useful for the teaching of spelling. He strongly advocates the “look, cover, write and check” system which is explained during the interview.

results.title: Catchment Boards at work: Nelson
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit and Apex Films
results.brief_description: How cultivation of the Nelson Province is being extended by scientific treatment of the soil; also, how further erosion is being prevented by control of the river catchments. Shows the co-ordinated program in the upper catchment areas and river control in the lower parts of the district. Commentary by Bill Beavis. Photography by George Hobbs.

results.title: Catching stripies: tuna fishing
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Fisheries and Wildlife
results.brief_description: Shows experimental trials using new equipment and fishing techniques for catching striped tuna near Lakes Entrance in Victoria. Alos shows aspects of the work carried out on the fishing boat.

results.title: Catching stars of baseball
results.brief_description: An instructional film by four of America’s leading catchers in the major baseball leagues. Aimed at junoir baseballers where very few want to take a catcher’s job. Covers areas such as equipment required, stance, signals, throwing, catching, tactics and tagging.

results.title: Catching crocodiles
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and Noel Monkman
results.brief_description: This film, showing aspects of the life of crocodile hunters on the Gulf of Carpentaria, was one of eleven short Australian educational films produced by Efftee Studios as a result of a partnership between naturalist Noel Monkman and Frank Thring Snr. Monkman photographed and directed the films and Frank Thring Snr narrated most of them. Two series were produced: the “Barrier Reef” series which consisted of five films and the “Australian Marvelogue” series, of which “Catching Crocodiles” is one of six. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Catch the Wind
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department and University of Western Australia
results.brief_description: Catch the Wind is a guide to dinghy sailing designed for instructors, schools, sail-training institutes and beginners. It is designed to provide a thorough and entertaining introduction to the basics of sailing.

results.title: Catch 22 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Filmways, John Calley, Martin Ransohoff and Mike Nichols
results.brief_description: Mike Nichols directed this cinematic adaptation by Buck Henry of Joseph Heller’s scathing, iconic novel, “Catch 22.” Fresh from the success of the anti-establishment hit “The Graduate,” the pair attempted to present an anti-war treatise, epitomised in Heller’s prose. A tale of a small group of flyers in the Mediterranean in 1944, the story centres on Captain Yossarian, a pilot who is manic in his desire to fly no more missions and haunted by the death of a gunner. Yossarian’s plea that he is mad falls on deaf ears - if a pilot knows that flying is a death mission, he is clearly not mad. There are winners, losers, opportunists, and survivors; separately and together they are nervous, frightened, often profane and sometimes pathetic and almost all are a little crazy. Despite slavish adherence to the novel’s plot, Nichols never quite manages to capture the book’s anarchic flavour and thorny, intelligent wit. Nevertheless the film still serves as a timely reminder of the lunacy of combat and Heller’s titular clause retains a stinging indictment on the sanctioned idiocy of war. An all star cast includes Alan Arkin, Art Garfunkel, Anthony Perkins, Martin Sheen, Jon Voight, Orson Welles and Bob Newhart.

results.title: Catch 'em being good (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Synergetic Productions, Ron Friedman and Marlene Schneider
results.brief_description: Instructional film for teachers demonstrating various approaches to motivating and disciplining students in the classroom. Shows methods for teachers to get the best out of their students, particularly the more difficult ones.
